page.title: 10HISTORY: TEDSTONE DELAMERE
page.content: The church at Lower Sapey is at the end of a very long lane. The Church is now falling to ruin, although some degree of restoration work has been undertaken. It is of Norman foundation, with a south doorway and in the West a small window also Norman. The exterior is built of cob and daub, and the inside walls are plastered. Part of the West gallery survives. Sapey Brook flows past the Church to join the Teme at Knightsford. Near to Sapey Church there is an old half timbered farmhouse with the remains of a moat or pond.
